text: in this video you'll see how to detect
unusual activity in AWS accounts using
cloud trail insights with this feature
you can continuously analyze management
events from your cloud trail trails
uncover unusual patterns in these events
and investigate anomalies to determine
their causes cloud trail insights is a
cloud trail feature that helps you
identify unusual operational activity in
your AWS accounts such as spikes and
resource provisioning and bursts of AWS
Identity and Access Management iam
actions to demonstrate this capability
let's begin by navigating to the cloud
trail dashboard
to take advantage of cloud trail
insights you must first enable it for a
trail
a trail is a configuration that enables
delivery of cloud trail events to an
Amazon s3 bucket cloud watch logs and
cloud watch events select the trail you
want to enable and then scroll down the
configuration settings to the insights
events section next to enable the
logging of insights events click the
edit button and then change the login
sites events setting to yes please note
that additional charges apply save the
new setting
Klout trail insights has now been
enabled for this trail although it can
take up to 36 hours before you receive
the first insights events
Klout trail insights continuously
analyzes cloud trail right management
events detects unusual API activity and
surfaces that activity by delivering
insights events let's refresh this view
and see some examples of insights events
here are some events that cloud trail
insights has surfaced as unusual
operational activity let's select one
and investigate further
this page displays a graph of API call
volume over a period of time before and
after one or more incites events are
logged in this example the red band
shows an unusual spike in start
automation execution API calls per
minute further down the page you can
view additional information about this
insight such as event IDs associated
with the start and end of the unusual
activity you can also view the event
record for this insight
here you can view more information about
the insight such as the expected
baseline average and the insight event
average let's scroll back up and take a
look at the cloud trail events tab
this tab shows cloud trail management
events related to the subject API that
occurred between the start and end time
of the incites event these events
provide helpful data that can be used to
perform deeper analysis select an
individual event to view more
information you can also drill down
further and view all the metadata
associated with this event
events generated by insights are
delivered to your s3 bucket configured
in the trail and optionally to Amazon
Cloud watch logs this lets you integrate
incites events with other event
management and workflow systems you can
also create alerts on incites events
using cloud watch events rules you've
just seen how to detect unusual activity
in AWS accounts using Cloud trail
insights thanks for watching now it's
your turn to try
